div.bibl: Lietuva, Vol. I, No. 24, June 24, 1893THE FIRST LITHUANIAN HOTEL

body.p: The first Lithuanian hotel in Chicago is opened by St. Rokosza, 749 W. 18th street. The hotel is very clean and modern, with first class beds; the meals are most delicious, and the prices are reasonable and good beer and whisky are served too.
There is a large and nice hall where every second Saturday are held dances. Many young Lithuanian men and beautiful girls are coming there to dance and for social entertainment.
